highlights: Science Operations Manager: Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter, SHARAD Instrument (continued) -- Architect of the U.S. science operation center for processing and scientific investigation of radar data from the SHARAD instrument on Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter. Designed the "WebMap" GIS visualization application used in scientific target planning, GIS analysis, and in distribution of processed scientific results. I've presented this work at two national AIAA SpaceOps conferences.
Mission Specialist: Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter, LAMP Instrument -- Designed the cartography pipeline for producing mapped and calibrated instrument results

New Horizons Mission to Pluto -- Database designer for the “SciPlan” web application used to build the final all-instrument acquisition plan for the closest approach to Pluto, successfully completed in July 2015.

GRAIL Lunar Gravity Mission -- Created a geo-database of our best knowledge of all the Moon’s craters by merging multiple sources. Developed a graphical application to model the gravity signal around selected craters.
Rosetta Mission: Alice instrument -- Designed the web application used for distribution and visualization of science results from the Alice UV instrument in orbit with comet 67P/Churyumov–Gerasimenko
NASA Space Radiation Laboratory, Brookhaven National Laboratory -- Radiation Experiment Proctor
Provided collaborative research and technical support for signal processing and material simulations written in FORTRAN, C, IDL, Matlab, and other commercial finite element and GIS environments.
Supported planetary research activities, including two spaceborne ground penetrating radar instruments on the current Mars Express and Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter missions.

System architect of the Washington University SHARAD Radar Processing System (WU-SHARPS), the exclusive U.S. operation for processing ground penetrating radar data from the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter.

Conducted aeronautic product development research for Solutia (now a subsidiary of Eastman Chemical). I synthesized candidate corrosion inhibiting additives, built our testing rig, created analytical process controls in LabView and developed signal processing methods for detecting subtle changes in material behavior caused by corrosion.

Performed as an adjunct instructor of computer and information science at two campuses. Responsible for the instruction of college students and Air Force personnel. Also responsible for course development and maintaining a Linux based teaching network. Courses taught include .NET programming, Access databases, MS Office 2000 products, web design, and UNIX operating systems.

Analytical chemist responsible for the chemical analysis of water samples, management of reagents and equipment, and the development of a custom analysis results database. Experienced with a variety of methods and instruments. Also responsible for fieldwork including the collection of water and soil samples. Routinely applied statistical methods and my E.P.A. evaluations were always of the highest grade. Skills: Chemical Analysis, Chemical Synthesis
